pageContext.description:
A bust-length portrait of Friedrich III of Saxony facing right, wearing a black cap, a white pleated shirt and doublet with a fur collar. The sitter is shown against a light blue background. Two verses of letterpress on paper are stuck to the panel underneath the image, and a piece of paper with letterpress bearing his title is pasted in the top right corner. The woodcut pasted to the back of the panel is a bookplate with the coat-of-arms of the Electors of Saxony by Lucas Cranach and was first used in the Wittenberger Heiligthumsbuch (Wittenberg Reliquary Book).
[cda 2020]
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 20.5 x 14.5 cm
[British Museum online database: https://www.britishmuseum.org/collection/object/P_SLPictures-271; accessed 28.05.2020]
pageContext.inscription:
- on a separate piece of paper pasted in the upper right corner, three lines of letterpress:
'friderich der Drit / Chur- // furst und herzog zu // Sachssen' 
- beneath the image sixteen lines of letterpress in rhyming couplets:
'fridrich bin ich billich genand ...Von dem nicht wand gonst noch gelt.' 
- on the reverse of the panel:
a woodcut bearing the Saxon coat of arms

involvedPersons.name: Lucas Cranach the Elder
involvedPersons.remarks:
In 'List of Portraits' ... (1842, 1879) it is described as 'Limning of Frederick III of Saxony by Lucas Cranach the Elder'
[British Museum online database: https://www.britishmuseum.org/collection/object/P_SLPictures-271; accessed 28.05.2020]

pageContext.markings:
Recto:
- top left corner in black paint '55'
Verso:
- on the backing of the (twentieth-century) frame is annotated on a piece of paper by Campbell Dodgson: 'There is another version of this painting with the same lettering in type in the Augsburg Gallery // and yet another at Rheims'
[British Museum online database: https://www.britishmuseum.org/collection/object/P_SLPictures-271; accessed 28.05.2020]
